item.title: ESET introduces the latest version of its security suite for consumers, version 10
item.description:
ESET has introduced version 10 of its home security software lineup. Their top product, ESET Smart Security Premium, uses ESET’s NOD32 technology, designed for a balance of effective threat detection, speed, and user-friendliness. This latest version includes a new password manager for simplified secure logins and ESET Secure Data for robust and convenient file encryption. item.title: ESET introduces security solutions for small businesses
item.description:

item.title: ESET advocates for the use of two-factor authentication to enhance security for small and medium-sized businesses
item.description:
ESET, a cybersecurity company, cautions that small and medium-sized businesses (SMBs) are frequently targeted by cybercriminals due to the vulnerability of their data. Javelin Strategy & Research’s study reveals that stolen personal data fuels a multi-billion dollar industry. Lukas Raska, COO of ESET Asia, emphasizes the evolution of cybercrime from viruses to the current threat of identity theft, highlighting its potential to cripple businesses and compromise customer trust. Parvinder Walia, Director at ESET APAC, explains that SMBs are attractive targets because they often lack the robust cybersecurity budgets and dedicated personnel of larger companies...

item.title: 40% of Singaporeans have experienced a data breach within the last year
item.description:
Parvinder Walia, during his presentation, revealed that 72% of consumers react negatively to news of a company suffering a cyberattack or data breach. ESET, a cybersecurity software company, conducted a survey to examine consumer online behavior and perspectives on cybersecurity in light of recent data breaches. The ESET 2018 APAC Consumer Behaviour Survey found that 42% of Singaporeans had experienced some form of data breach in the preceding year. These breaches included theft and misuse of personal information, bank account fraud, social media account compromise, and attacks from malware and viruses...

item.title: Here are five tips for creating stronger passwords, according to ESET
item.description:
ESET, a cybersecurity company, used World Password Day on May 3rd as an opportunity to share advice on creating stronger passwords. World Password Day is a global event designed to promote the importance of strong passwords and safe online practices. ESET’s Senior Research Fellow, Nick FitzGerald, pointed out that even with secure password storage, weak or predictable passwords still leave users vulnerable to hacking. FitzGerald highlighted a recent case involving Singapore Airlines, where hackers may have exploited weak passwords to steal KrisFlyer frequent flyer miles...
